borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed double storey side extension, by reason of its design, mass and bulk would significantly enlarge the size of the original dwelling and alter the symmetry in relation to its adjoining twin.&nbsp; Furthermore, the double storey side element would lead to the closure of a prominent seperating the pairs of semi detached dwellings on Trinidad Gardens, thereby harming the character of the street scene.&nbsp;The significance of the location of the Becontree Estate adds further weight to the harm generated. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 and DMNE3 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CR2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP2 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>

<p>The proposed single storey front extension, by reason of its depth would appear unduly prominent, therefore harming the character and appearance of the dwelling house and the street scene along Trinidad Gardens. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>

<p>The proposed double storey side extension, by reason of its mass, bulk and proximity to the boundary would generate increased overshadowing and a loss of light to neighbouring properties. Therefore constituting an unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policy DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p>
description: Construction of a front porch, single storey front extension, two storey side extension and part two storey part single storey rear extension.
